author: A_Brickset_user
title: Blue Hopper car - too tall?
review:
One of the better wagons I've ever seen.  Possible the top is a little too tall, it may have been better a 1/3 of a brick or two shorter - who knows!

I think this is (along with the 12v petrol wagon (shell)) one of my favourites, I've made 5, the more the better!

author: jd5775
title: Great addition to any train
review: I personally love this set, and so should any train fan.  It goes really well when bunched with others, but also when next to the red hopper car from 4564.  The only problem is that the red hopper car is one stud shorter than the blue, but it really doesn't matter.  I also tried to put a layer of white smooth plates on top of the red, to give them equal height but it just didn't work.  Maybe red plates would work...  Anyway this set comes with a loading dock (really an unloading dock) that fits perfectly on to one piece of track and catches the 1x1 cylinder bricks very well.  Good set to buy a lot of but only if you were buying it at $16.50 (Price in my catalog).  Now they are between $50 and $75 dollars.

author: legotrainfan
title: The more the better
review:
I can only agree to those who believe that it's better to have more of those waggons to make a nice-looking freight train. I think blue is a nice colour for such a waggon but what I really find cool is that door at the waggon's bottom. There is a mechanism that allows you to unload the freight. The freight itself is also included in this set: round 1x1 bricks. 

I think this set is a great addition to 4563 or crocodile engine 4551. Maybe you'll also like it as an addition to Hopper Waggon 10017. Both 4536 and 10017 serve the same purpose.
